attributes.action: look into the BBC's abdication of its weekly commitment to 1920s and 1930s dance band music, as a matter of minority representation.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In December 2008, BBC Radio 2 ended its weekly half-hour of music by 1920s and 1930s British dance bands, in order to extend its coverage of big band music. This programme had an audience close in number to the audiences of the BBC's minority-interest digital stations 1Xtra and the Asian Network (1Xtra's reach is 634,000, and the Asian Network's reach is 421,000, while in late 2008, Malcolm Laycock's show was pulling in 511,000 listeners). While it is right that these minorities are served properly by the BBC, how can the BBC justify denying a minority of equal size a mere 30 minutes of airtime per week?

rejection.details:
Please raise your concerns with Ofcom
http://www.ofcom.org.uk/complain/progs/
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
